Upadaṁsitar，[n．ag．fr．upadaṁseti] one who shows Pug．49 （where upadhaṁsita is to be corrected to upad°，as already pointed out by Morris J P T S．1887，126．The word seems to be a crux to commentators，philologists，and translators，like upadaṁseti．Kern，Toev．s．v．keeps to the reading upah°，tries to connect it with Sk．dharṣati & trsl<sup>s．</sup> “one who confirms”．The Pug．A leaves the word unexplained）．（Page 142）
